Event.name: Corroding_caused
Event.definition: <def-root>In this frame, the <fen>Patient</fen>, an inorganic item, undergoes a chemical process caused by another entity, which renders it less useful, desirable or stable. The process may or may not be under the control of an <fen>Agent</fen>. <ex></ex> <ex><fex name="Patient">The metal</fex> was <t>corroded</t> <fex name="Cause">by the water</fex>. </ex><ex><fex name="Cause">Acid rain</fex> <t>corroded</t> <fex name="Patient">the metal</fex> <fex name="Result">into a mass of slime</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Degree</fen> to which the <fen>Cause</fen> corrodes the <fen>Patient</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Duration</fen> of time for which the <fen>Cause</fen> corrodes the <fen>Patient</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Initial_state
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Initial_state</fen> of the <fen>Patient</fen>. <ex>Acid rain <t>corroded</t> the metal <fex name="I_state">from its former shininess</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Cause</fen> corrodes the <fen>Patient</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Explanation</fen> for which the <fen>Patient</fen> is corroded.</def-root>

Arg.name: Result
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Result</fen> of the caused corrosion. <ex><fex name="Patient">The metal</fex> was <t>corroded</t> <fex name="Result">into a mass of slime</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Cause</fen> corrodes the <fen>Patient</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Patient
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Patient</fen> is corroded by the <fen>Cause</fen>. <ex><fex name="Patient">The metal</fex> was <t>corroded</t> by the water.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Speed
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Speed</fen> at which the <fen>Cause</fen> corrodes the <fen>Patient</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Subregion
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Subregion</fen> identifies the part of a larger whole that is affected. <ex>Acid rain <t>corroded</t> the metal <fex name="sub">around the edges</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Manner</fen> in which the <fen>Cause</fen> corrodes the <fen>Patient</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Means</fen> by which the <fen>Cause</fen> corrodes the <fen>Patient</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Purpose</fen> for which the <fen>Patient</fen> is corroded.</def-root>

Arg.name: Cause
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Cause</fen> identifies an animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that corrodes the <fen>Patient</fen>. Volitionality is not a necessary characteristic of <fen>Cause</fen>. <ex><fex name="Cause">Acid rain</fex> <t>corroded</t> the metal.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Instrument
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> may use an <fen>Instrument</fen> to cause the corrosion.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: corrode.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: destroy or damage (metal or other hard material) slowly by chemical action.

lexUnit.name: oxidize.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause to combine with oxygen.

lexUnit.name: tarnish.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause to lose lustre, especially as a result of exposure to air or moisture

lexUnit.name: rust.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to cause something to have a coating of iron oxide
